ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 117
ygData.msgSnippet: Pure spell casters would be defined as Wizard, Enchanter, Magician, and Necromancer.  I would not consider Druid or Clerics as pure spell casters. Just my own
ygData.messageBody:
Pure spell casters would be defined as Wizard, Enchanter, Magician, and
Necromancer. I would not consider Druid or Clerics as pure spell casters.
Just my own opinion :)

Cwelanas, Minstrel of the 6th Chord

> ----------

> :Bind Affinity is for pure spellcasters, not hybrids or
> jack-of-all-trades.
> :My Cleric has traveled much more than my Bard, and this was before the
> Cleric had Bind Affinity.
>
> Correct me if I'm wrong (not meant to be sarcastic), but Clerics are
> actually not pure spellcasters. Wizards, Enchanters, Magicians, and
> Druids
> are the only pure spellcasters (Druids technically being a hybrid, but
> only
> of pure spellcasters, thus making them one). Clerics are a hybrid of
> warrior and spellcaster (healing spells). This is proven by the fact that
> they can use heavy metal armor and strong blunt weapons, and can usually
> hold their own in battle, yet being a very effective magic class at the
> same
> time with healing spells. So, if they are a hybrid and get Bind
> Affinity...
>
> -Qefnir, a slow moving Bard in Tarrew Marr
